title: Why free riders cause market failure

content.question: Which of the following explains why free-riding can result in a market failure?

choices.label: More than the socially optimal quantity is produced and consumed.
The socially optimal quantity is produced but less than the socially optimal quantity is consumed.
Private producers of nonexcludable goods are unable to charge everyone who consumes the good.
There is a market surplus of the good.
There is no consumer surplus derived from the good.

content.answer: Private producers of nonexcludable goods are unable to charge everyone who consumes the good.
